verses.kjv: O Israel, return unto the LORD thy God; for thou hast fallen by thine iniquity.
verses.web: Israel, return to LORD your God; for you have fallen because of your sin.
verses.ct: Israel, come back to the LORD your God! Your sin is what brought you down.

verses.kjv: Take with you words, and turn to the LORD: say unto him, Take away all iniquity, and receive us graciously: so will we render the calves of our lips.
verses.web: Take words with you, and return to LORD. Tell him, “Forgive all our sins, and accept that which is good: so we offer our lips like bulls.
verses.ct: Bring your words of repentance and return to the LORD. Say to him, "Forgive all our sin and accept what is good. We will offer the praise of our lips as our sacrifice.

verses.kjv: Asshur shall not save us; we will not ride upon horses: neither will we say any more to the work of our hands, Ye are our gods: for in thee the fatherless findeth mercy.
verses.web: Assyria can’t save us. We won’t ride on horses; neither will we say any more to the work of our hands, ‘Our gods!’ for in you the fatherless finds mercy.”
verses.ct: Assyria cannot save us. We won't rely on warhorses. We will never again call the things our hands have made 'our gods,' because you are the one who shows mercy to the fatherless."

verses.kjv: I will heal their backsliding, I will love them freely: for mine anger is turned away from him.
verses.web: “I will heal their waywardness. I will love them freely; for my anger is turned away from him.
verses.ct: "I will heal their unfaithfulness. I will love them freely, because my anger has turned away from them.

verses.kjv: I will be as the dew unto Israel: he shall grow as the lily, and cast forth his roots as Lebanon.
verses.web: I will be like the dew to Israel. He will blossom like the lily, and send down his roots like Lebanon.
verses.ct: I will be like the dew to Israel. He will blossom like the lily and send his roots deep like the cedars of Lebanon.

verses.kjv: His branches shall spread, and his beauty shall be as the olive tree, and his smell as Lebanon.
verses.web: His branches will spread, and his beauty will be like the olive tree, and his fragrance like Lebanon.
verses.ct: His branches will spread wide. He will be as beautiful as an olive tree, and his fragrance will be like Lebanon.

verses.kjv: They that dwell under his shadow shall return; they shall revive as the corn, and grow as the vine: the scent thereof shall be as the wine of Lebanon.
verses.web: Men will dwell in his shade. They will revive like the grain, and blossom like the vine. Their fragrance will be like the wine of Lebanon.
verses.ct: People will flourish again in his shade. They will spring to life like grain and bloom like the vine, and their reputation will be as rich as the wine of Lebanon.

verses.kjv: Ephraim shall say, What have I to do any more with idols? I have heard him, and observed him: I am like a green fir tree. From me is thy fruit found.
verses.web: Ephraim, what have I to do any more with idols? I answer, and will take care of him. I am like a green cypress tree; from me your fruit is found.”
verses.ct: Ephraim will say, 'What do I have to do with idols anymore?' I have heard him, and I am watching over him. I am like a green cypress tree — your fruitfulness comes from me."

verses.kjv: Who is wise, and he shall understand these things? prudent, and he shall know them? for the ways of the LORD are right, and the just shall walk in them: but the transgressors shall fall therein.
verses.web: Who is wise, that he may understand these things? Who is prudent, that he may know them? For the ways of LORD are right, and the righteous walk in them; But the rebellious stumble in them.
verses.ct: Who is wise enough to understand these things? Who has the insight to grasp them? The ways of the LORD are right. The righteous walk in them, but those who rebel will stumble and fall.
